Detailed Description

Base class for all file importers/exporters.

This class provides functionality common to all file importers and exporters such as the ability to edit options before file import/export. Also, this class provides functions for importers/exporters to report errors to the user/log file, and provides static convenience functions for dissecting file paths into their parts.

Member Function Documentation

QString DzFileIO::changeFileExtension ( const QString &  filename,
const QString &  newExtension 
) [static]
Parameters:
filename File path to operate on.
newExtension The extension that the will replace any current extension on the given filename.
Returns:
The given filename with the new extension in place of of any existing extension.
Example:
    QString newPath1 = DzFileIO::changeFileExtension( "/user/filename.txt", "rtf" );        // newPath1 = "/user/filename.rtf"
    QString newPath2 = DzFileIO::changeFileExtension( "C:\\temp\\filename.JPG", "tif" );    // newPath2 = "C:\temp\filename.tif"

const QString &  tgtFilename,
bool  showProgress = false 
) [static]

Copies the file to another location

Parameters:
srcFilename The full path of the source file.
tgtFilename The full path of the target file.
Returns:
true if successful, otherwise false.
void DzFileIO::error ( const QString &  msg  )  [protected]

Report an error. This simply reports information to the user via the interface. It does not redirect program flow.

Parameters:
msg The error message that will be displayed and printed to the log.
void DzFileIO::finishIO (  )  [protected, virtual]

Child classes should call this function when finishing the reading/writing of a file. (currently this is used for massive error overload control)

QString DzFileIO::fixName ( const QString &  str  )  [static]

Replaces illegal characters in a string so that the string may be used as the name of a file or folder. The characters replaced are: '/', '*', ':', '<', '>', '?', '\', '|'. Characters are replaced by the hexadecimal ascii value of the character in braces - i.e. '\' would be replaced by '{5C}'.

Parameters:
str The string to be turned into a valid filename.
Returns:
The value of str with any illegal characters replaced by legal characters.
QString DzFileIO::getBaseFileName ( const QString &  filename  )  [static]
Parameters:
filename File path to operate on.
Returns:
Just the filename portion of the file path.
Example:
    QString name1 = DzFileIO::getBaseFileName( "/user/filename.txt" );      // name1 = "filename"
    QString name2 = DzFileIO::getBaseFileName( "C:\\temp\\filename.JPG" );  // name2 = "filename"
QString DzFileIO::getFileExtension ( const QString &  filename  )  [static]
Parameters:
filename File path to operate on.
Returns:
The extension of the filename in lower case and not including the '.'
Example:
    QString ext1 = DzFileIO::getFileExtension( "/user/filename.txt" );      // ext1 = "txt"
    QString ext2 = DzFileIO::getFileExtension( "C:\\temp\\filename.JPG" );  // ext2 = "jpg"
QString DzFileIO::getFilePath ( const QString &  filename  )  [static]
Parameters:
filename File path to operate on.
Returns:
The path of the file - the filename from the beginning up to (but not including) the last path separator.
Example:
    QString path1 = DzFileIO::getFilePath( "/user/filename.txt" );      // path1 = "/user"
    QString path2 = DzFileIO::getFilePath( "C:\\temp\\filename.JPG" );  // path2 = "C:\temp"
QStringList DzFileIO::getFilesFromDirectory ( const QString &  dirPath,
const QStringList &  extentions,
bool  recursive = true 
) [static]

Static method which takes a directory absolute path and returns a QStringList of the files under that directory.

Parameters:
dirPath QString containing the absolute path of the directory.
extentions QStringList containing extentions of files to find. Format of the strings should be: "*.ext"
recursive Boolean indicating if the search should be recursive or not.
Returns:
QStringList containing the found files.
bool DzFileIO::getOptions ( DzFileIOSettings *  options,
bool  useInterface,
const QString &  filename 
) const [virtual, slot]

Gets the options for an import operation.

Parameters:
options The settings object that the selected options will be added to.
useInterface If true, the options interface for the importer/exporter will be displayed to the user, if false, the default (or last-used) options will be returned.
Returns:
The options for an import/export operation, NULL if the user cancelled.
DzFileIOFrame * DzFileIO::getOptionsFrame (  )  const [virtual]

Gets the options interface for an I/O operation. Subclasses should reimplement this function to return a new instance of the options interface for the Importer/Exporter. The default implementation always returns NULL.

Returns:
A pointer to the options interface, NULL if no interface is available. The caller takes ownership of this pointer and is responsible for deleting it.
QString DzFileIO::getPreIOErrorString (  )  [protected, virtual]

Child classes must override this function if they want to provide an options interface.

Returns:
A frame containing options for the importer/exporter, the default implementation returns NULL.

DzFileIOFrame* DzFileIO::getOptionsInterface() { return NULL; }

/** Derived classes can override this if they need to do error checking before attempting to export the file. If this method returns a non-empty string, it is displayed to the user as an error condition and the file export is halted.

Returns:
An error string to be displayed to the user, if any. The default implementation returns an empty string.
QString DzFileIO::getShortFileName ( const QString &  filename  )  [static]
Parameters:
filename File path to operate on.
Returns:
Just the filename and extension portion of the file path.
Example:
    QString name1 = DzFileIO::getShortFileName( "/user/filename.txt" );     // name1 = "filename.txt"
    QString name2 = DzFileIO::getShortFileName( "C:\\temp\\filename.JPG" ); // name2 = "filename.JPG"

bool DzFileIO::pathExists ( const QString &  path,
bool  create = false 
) [static]

Checks to see if the given path exists

Parameters:
path The directory to check the existence of.
create If true, this function will attempt to create the directory if it does not exist
Returns:
true if the path exists or was successfully created, otherwise false.
void DzFileIO::resetUserFindFile (  )  [static]

Resets the flags so that users will again be prompted to find a missing file if userFindFile() is called.

bool DzFileIO::showOptions (  )  const [slot]
Returns:
true if this importer/exporter should display an options dialog by default.
void DzFileIO::startIO (  )  [protected, virtual]

Child classes should call this function when beginning the reading/writing of a file. (currently this is used for massive error overload control)

bool DzFileIO::userFindFile ( const QString &  filename,
QString &  foundPath 
) [static]

If asking the user is enabled, this method will prompt the user to find a replacement file for one that cannot be found.

Parameters:
filename File that cannot be found (full or partial path).
foundPath Path to found or selected replacement file (full path), if found.
Returns:
true if a replacement file was found.
